data.title: Great food and friendly service
data.text: I love Thai food and this was some of the best I've ever had. Don't miss the larb, chicken w/basil - so many things I enjoy, it is hard to pick the very best.

data.title: Mr Greg Douglas
data.text:
Hidden Jem of Baton Rouge!! Great all around food !! Authentic Thai food and very friendly servers !! A must for a great lunch!! 
A must visit if your in the area you will not be disappointed !!

data.title: Don't judge a building by it's exterior
data.text: A buffet awaits to fulfill your Thai crave! There is much to taste and enjoy; main entrees (vegetarian to chicken to pork), sides, soups, to desserts (sticky rice pudding). There's always a hefty crowd during lunch- a great reflection to loyal and well-informed taste buds!

data.title: Eat Here Once a Week...
data.text:
I have dinner here once a week without fail. The Chicken Larb appetizer is quite frankly the best I have had anywhere - EVER!sometimes I order it as an entree!! I have set on trying a different curry every week - the green curry with shrimp is perfectly spiced and full of tasty shrimp! All their Thai curry is excellent. The Basil Chicken is also quite good! 

I'm not fond of buffets anywhere so I have not tried lunch here. But dinner is off the charts good!!

Wish I could give this place more than five stars!!

data.title: Best Thai food, some Philippine influences
data.text: Been going here for two decades. To my knowledge, it is the same chef still. The food is outrageously good! Go for buffet right when it opens at 11 AM and you will thank me. Ordering at night is great too, and I'd recommend a pot of soup. Lunch favs are soup, steak salad, larb, yellow curry, basil chicken, and deserts. But it is all great. The spicy tofu, my gosh I forgot the spring rolls with their sauce in the back corner, the grilled seasoned chicken dish, thai omlet, .. I could go on. Best darn food in town! My kids and wife love it too.

data.title: Yummy Thai Food!!!
data.text:
We so loved this Thai Food. Everyone in my family loved their lunch. My favorite was the vegetarian Pad Thai. My son liked the fried brown rice. My husband enjoyed the chicken dish. My daughter ate the Spring rolls. The lemon grass soup was very good.!!
Very reasonably priced. We will go back!

data.title: AWESOME
data.text: One of me favorite Thai restaurants in Baton Rouge!!!  The food is awesome.  I love the larb and the sweet basil chicken or beef.  The service is always courteous and excellent.

data.title: Great Thai food.
data.text: Stopped at Baton Rouge for lunch and found this place online. The food is freshly served while the selection is abundant for a lunch buffet. This is my first time at a Thai buffet and I have to say it opens a new horizon for me. Thai doesn't mean pad Thai or chicken curry anymore. Must try this place again when drive by. Great food overall.

data.title: Bad, and Really Bad
data.text: Was here several time before and the food was excellent.  Returned on the 25 November with family and friends while visiting Baton Rouge and things have really changed. With 7 friend and family members, each of us having a different plate, each plate was horrible.  The food was not tasty over cooked and raunchy and definitely not fresh. Not one of the seven plates we had was any good.  I have visited many Thai restaurants before, and this was definitely the worse yet.  Even the vegetables  were overcooked.  Don't know whether this was an anomaly, but I definitely will not return.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: I went through the buffet at Thai Pepper for lunch yesterday and tried it for the first time. The food was fresh and hot which is a concern with any buffet. They had a nice variety of dishes for a small buffet. The food was okay, nothing outstanding or inedible. The dish I liked best was the coconut chicken soup. I was mildly disappointed with the peanut chicken, kind of bland. All in all it was okay, nothing special. I may give them another chance as I like Thai food.

data.title: Fresh, Simple, Friendly, and Tasty Thai
data.text: I've only been here for the lunch buffet.  However, this place has turned into an addiction for me rarely going longer than two weeks without a visit.  The first thing that comes to mind with Thai Pepper is the quality of the food.  The freshness of the food taste more like it was prepared in a home than in a restaurant.  The vegetables are fresh and are replaced before they get suspect.  They even take the time to devein the shrimp; try to find that attention to detail at another lunch buffet!  Great little lunch spot that has become one of my favorites in Baton Rouge.

data.title: Really good Thai food in a simple setting.
data.text:
First time to this restaurant for dinner and was pleased by the friendly service, the quality of the food, very reasonable prices and generous portions.  They had several excellent vegetarian options and fish choices.
Parking convenient (they have a lot).
Mon-Sat 11:00-14:00 and 17:00 - 21:00 (dinner). Reservations: 225-924-7389.
They take major credit cards with the exception of American Express (Figure that must be because AMEX charges merchants a whole lot more than other cards, so not worth offering that option).
Would definitely come here again when back in town.
Please comment if you find this review useful. Thank you.

data.title: Best Thai Restaurant in town
data.text: I've been a regular customer since 2000 and all I can say is that the food and friendly service never dissapoints. I love Thai food and Thai Pepper unique flavor seasoning is second to none. Keep the good job guys

data.title: Friendly little restaurant in Mid City
data.text: Dinner here on a weeknight while visiting family.  Clean, updated interior since our last visit a few years back.  Odd music in the background, Bach Phantom of the Opera organ fugue; then it switched to more traditional Asian instrumental.  Attentive staff but limited menu, would have liked to have a meat salad but couldn't find one listed.  Limited drink offerings too; had a Singha. Ordered the tom yum goong, which was tasty, and shared the pad woon sen, which was average.  Bottom line: there are better alternatives in Baton Rouge.

data.title: Quiet little place with good food.
data.text: This understated gem offers good food, personable service and reasonable prices.  The Sweet Basil dish with tofu as excellent.  Just right on the spice level and everything was fresh.  The pad thai was not the best I have had, but it was okay.  Don't let the exterior fool you, this place is a real treat.

data.title: Average buffet.
data.text: We eat here regularly with bigger business groups. Food is average, and service is quality. I don't mind going here with a group for lunch, but wouldn't choose to dine here on my own.

data.title: Best Thai in BtR
data.text: Authentic, not greasy, very clean, and very attentive staff. We ordered sesame wraps, coconut soup, pad thai, and shrimp yellow curry. Everything was great! The sesame wraps were flavorful, the coconut soup was the best I've ever had, the pad thai was good - my only criticism is I prefer a lime slice on the side and they applied it in back - and the yellow curry was excellent. Service was fast and attentive. Very fresh veggies and seafood, excellent use of spices, overall a lovely experience. We plan to return.

data.title: Real Thai Taste
data.text: Although the restaurant has been open for a number of years, there's a new management & it has made a big difference. I found authentic Thai cuisine at reasonable prices. A menu selection of freshly prepared items made with extra lean meats, local seafoods & traditional seasonings enhance the dining experience. At the Thai Pepper, you're treated like family, because this establishment is a family operation. Take outs & catering are available. Lunch Buffet: Mon-Sat, 11-2; Dinner: Mon-Sat, 5-9. Wine & beer list.
